bow: what your favorite snack for your nine to twelve month old my son just turned nine months the other day and making the transition for him to bigger people food he does extremely well and his two bottom teeth are about third of the way in just looking for some new ideas disclaimer my son is too young for solids this is from my experience at daycare centre soft fruit especially big pieces that your child can hold half banana or wedge of watermelon also orange segments sandwiches cut into quarters live in australia and the kids here nearly all enjoy vegemite muffins are good too pretty much anything soft that can be held and gnawed on live in the so unfortunately do hear much about veggimite lol but ll try those he been eating baby food and bits of food that he can eat that ve been having but want to expand his food choices he good eater not very picky just getting to that point where baby food is only good for so much avocado is bit hit with lo it can be hard to grasp since it is slippery so sometimes make coating of crushed up cheerios to make it easier to grab he also like pancakes try adding sweet potatoes or pumpkin made some baby muffins with banana and pumpkin that were big hit those sound yummy think he like muffins he loves sweet potatoes do you have specific recipe for baby muffins these are the muffins made big hit it made lot so ended up freezing some http simplegreenmoms com baby pumpkin muffins also found this website to have lot of great ideas and recipes http wholesomebabyfood momtastic com babyfingerfood htm vcny4bz0zow for 12 months you are almost always dealing with teething was nursing for nutrition at this point with my first and food was just for fun but these three things were baby approved and mommy approved nutritious hummus with pita or rice or carrots carrot chips or mini carrots either are great while they are teething not nutritious but great for teething pizza crusts my amazing mother of two aunt recommended this when my first was teething seriously thought wtf until tried it amazing frozen eggo waffles the little pockets catch drool the cool numbs their gums what not to love my 18 month old loved bananas when she was starting big people food she did get any teeth until she was almost year old so lots of mushy food went over well with her pasta crackers bread yogurt and oatmeal too awesome thanks for sharing will have to try these out oh yeah this has been an ongoing thing poor little guy got two teeth in one its been little rough he does like cold stuff besides water so its been tough trying to console him but will try the other things out yeah unfortunately little man has two teeth already and he wo be one until christmas so we ve only just begun he does like bananas though ll give the other stuff try thanks my lo loves finger foods so we have lot of finger foods that are safe to eat chunks of banana toast berries soft boiled veggies my littles favourite is cheese though cut up slice of cheese in to small chunks and he goes crazy we also do yogurts and unsweetened applesauce and baby loves them too you re welcome if you re in the us gerber has yogurt bites that melt down too that may be good snack too ll have to look into those too in addition to some of the other things here half cut frozen grapes for teething it was big hit in our house applesauce has always been favorite for him he ll only eat green beans if mix them with applesauce lol he does okay with cheese although sometimes it upsets his stomach love to give him frozen stuff but he seems to reject anything cold my son love fruit cups mandarin oranges specifically he loves puffs the graduates cheeto type things avocado yogurt cheese cubes okay had never heard of using frozen waffles until friend mentioned it like days ago now you guess picking up waffles tomorrow my kid hated anything cold forever he cut his first teeth at months and he now year old with full teeth and that are halfway it been long months without the help of cold stuff he is just now starting to take frozen teethers refrigerated raw corn my toddler is still fiend for this and boyo is hopping right on the train with him it great for soothing sore gums it sweet without being way too sugary and they can gnaw suck on it pretty much indefinitely we cut through the cob in thirds or sometimes save whole cobs that we ve taken most of the kernels off of for salads sautés and let them gnaw on those mhm mine does like anything hot right now it probably phase try half grapes but not frozen they re cool naturally and then maybe you could sneak them in the fridge for little bit and eventually the freezer it does really help with teething as far as food goes do remember much else we fed him at that age someone said avocado which know we did he made mess and really enjoyed himself when did you start yogurt he does get much cheese maybe one slice of cheese every couple days save it for day when really want to get him to eat something we use the purée food pouches too they are great when we re on the go can totally relate he never really liked anything cold but his water and that ca be in sippy or bottle just through straw it been rough but ve found the orajel naturals helps numb his gums and helps him get some sleep hmm ve never heard of that before but hey do knock it until you ve tried it it probably is but ll have to try out the grapes either way its good snack for him when eat something with cheese on it give him little my brother and were both slightly lactose intolerant so wondering if my son will be too ve heard those were good too my yr old still loves frozen waffles be very careful if you try corn kernels they re choking hazard for kids that age watch him pretty carefully he had corn before he just liked to chew it when its on the cob yeah there are lot of foods would never have thought my kids would be into frozen peas frozen hash browns raw corn raw butternut squash that were all discovered when my boys snatched things off my prep board while was cooking we did baby led weaning so was never too concerned about choking since they learned early on what they could and could not handle started yogurt right at months we get the stonyfield yobaby kind my month old looooooves it and rarely goes day without some there are lot of different fruit flavors or you can buy vanilla and add whatever you like yourself mine loves the apple flavor when we have corn on the cob let him gnaw on it he seemed to like it found out he is fond of pickles already my pregnancy craving ca say surprised lol he likes to try whatever he can get his hands on ll have to try that think he would enjoy it lot my fiance and have always been big on yogurt so ve been waiting for my son to be able to eat it too lol we started her on it because she was taking antibiotics and had horrible diarrhea so knew yogurt would help her belly she ended up loving it it the only food she ll let me feed her now everything else has to be real foods she can pick up herself lol lol always funny how independent they want to be although mine is going through the only mommy and daddy are allowed to be with me hold me etc not that mind all the extra snuggles lol wan na say 10 months they have infant yogurt that he liked now he eats the graduates toddler yogurt it got fruit and veggies in it stoneybrook is also good brand for them it just tends to get stringy ll look into it my kiddo love dried dates at that age big enough to hold on to and she could gum it to death ll look into those thanks peas green beans banana sweet potato avocado noodles edit the organic pouches are great for new combintions of foods we made our own with plain stonyfield greek and banana and or peach smooshed in it same with cottage cheese feel it has less sugar than the yobaby ones noodles are always great banana bits with sesame butter or peanut butter are favorite prefer greek yogurt anyways so much better oh sure he love that at that age princess crow loved bananas steamed carrots steamed sweet potatoes steamed apples pears gerber baby puffs toast she ate pretty much what we did from the beginning but for snacks and sides these were our go to items oh yeah he ll eat what we do just needed some healthy snack ideas forgot to add avocados and plain yogurt yogurt was disaster until my kid figured out spoons bit it actually still quite mess but she looooved it and she very small kid so we re always trying to sneak in extra calories with avocado or peanut butter you may get some ideas from here http youtube com playlist list=plug cu0tbhwds7x4pggxnvynhsz ow there is pastina with zucchini http www jamieoliver com videos healthy family pasta michela chiappa my daughter loves my lo is soon to be ten months we started doing baby led weaning check it out if you have it great so she been on adult food from the start some favourites string cheese give it to her whole hummus with carrot sticks or apple slices oatmeal banana cookies mash together and bake so yummy half banana and yogurt she likes the plain whole fat yogurt if we re out and trying to stay clean put it in reusable pouch like these https www amazon com dp b00du1fwwc ref=cm sw awd bjikub0j6vqan it so easy and if you use them twice they pay for themselves we fill them with all kinds of everything and freeze until we re ready to use serious life saver good luck yogurt will definitely be go and peanut butter he just really starting to get ready for the big people food cool thanks ll have to check more into the baby led weaning and those pouches thank you as treat graham cracker it easy to munch with few teeth and it crunchy satisfying get the ones that are just sweetened sugar not the honey ones one of these things last about 30 minutes as she gnaws at it badder meinhoff phenomenon it happened to me with sloths what is canned pumpkin is that soup not mum from all but dried dehydrated banana perhaps yoghurt is the greatest snack no its basically pureed pumpkin in can if you are in the us you can find it in the baking aisle edamame shelled of course is by girl favorite food she is 15 months but she started eating it around 10 months it also happened to me recently with the word fuselage after the first time heard it heard it every single day for or days that good idea too :0 ve never heard of that what is it baked apple with little cinnamon was my lil bits favorite oatmeal was also very important to him still is at almost that sounds yummy soy beans do know where you are located but here north east usa you can find them in the frozen foods section just cook like you would any other vegetable
